alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:53PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Dona Ana County through 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mesquite. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, Vado, NMSU Main Campus, Mesquite, Talavera, High Valley, Dripping Springs, Soledad Canyon and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 142 and 155. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 3 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
